page.title: 14CHILDRENS GAMES
page.content: At play-time we often play{ {football.}We don't have a proper football pitch because the school is too small so we play on the tarred area of the playground. As there are only eleven children who play, we change the rules to suit. Another game we play is called {'Three Little Matchsticks.'}This is a miming game where one person (the king) has to guess what the others are doing. Once the king has guessed a mime correctly, he has to chase everyone until he catches the new 'king' and the game starts again. We also thought up a game called {'Cabbages.'}One person is 'It' and he chases the others. If someone is caught they have to lean against the wall. They can be freed if someone runs under their arms. Once everyone is caught the game is over.
